In 1994 a new excavation of part of the site was started by a team of professional archaeologists from a variety of academic and research institutes around the
. Led by Dr. Hafed Walda of Kings College London, and sponsored by the Society for Libyan Studies (established as a British Institute Abroad in 1969 and based at the Institute of Archaeology in
), this team has been conducting excavations of a building by the theatre for two seasons. Supposed to be the largest of the Roman Ruins in Libya, it is also called Lubda in Arabic.
Get a guide. The information at the site is limited.
Drinks only available at the entrance and not in the extensive site so stock up on the way in.
